title: quarkus-latest: add execution section to run report in maven phase
Eliminate duplication in title extraction logic
description: Both TableTestPublisher.getTitle() and JunitTableMetadata.getTitle() have similar logic for extracting titles from classes/methods with or without @DisplayName. Extract common title extraction pattern to eliminate duplication.

title: Document Spring Boot junit-platform.properties compatibility
description: Add findings to README that Spring Boot works fine with junit-platform.properties (unlike Quarkus which had conflicts). This completes the investigation started in tabletest-reporter-anu.
close_reason: Not needed. Investigation found Spring Boot has no compatibility issues with junit-platform.properties. The README's recommended approach already works correctly for Spring Boot. Only Quarkus needed a special note (which was added in tabletest-reporter-aam).

title: Add Gradle plugin to compatibility tests
description:
Add compatibility test for tabletest-reporter-gradle-plugin.

## Previous Attempts Summary

Two previous attempts failed due to JUnit Platform compatibility issues with Gradle's test runner:

### Issues Encountered:
1. **Java version conflicts**: Gradle 8.12+ Kotlin DSL doesn't support Java 25; required Java 21
2. **Spring Boot 4.0 requirements**: Required Gradle 8.14+ but incompatible with JUnit setup
3. **JUnit Platform version mismatches**: 
   - Error: OutputDirectoryProvider version alignment issues between JUnit Platform and Gradle test runner
   - Tried JUnit 6.0.1 → failed with discovery errors
   - Tried JUnit 5.12.0 → same issues
   - Gradle versions tested: 8.12, 8.14, 8.11 - all failed
4. **Test discovery failure**: Tests never ran; YAML files not generated
5. **Root cause**: Fundamental incompatibility between current Gradle versions and how JUnit Platform extensions work with OutputDirectoryProvider

### What needs investigation:
- Whether newer Gradle/JUnit Platform versions resolve compatibility
- Alternative approach for integrating reporter with Gradle test runner
- Possibly use Gradle 7.x or find workaround for extension registration

### Test Requirements:
- Gradle project using tabletest-reporter-gradle-plugin
- Generate YAML reports during test execution
- Verify report generation in test.sh script
- Use Java 21 (JAVA_HOME must be set correctly to avoid Kotlin DSL issues)

title: Generate title field for test classes without @DisplayName
description: TableTestPublisher should provide a title field in YAML for test classes even without @DisplayName annotation. Transform camelCase class name to human-readable title (e.g., LeapYearRules → Leap Year Rules)

title: Create spring-boot-latest compatibility test
Create quarkus-min compatibility test
Fix matching of empty string and null in scenario values
description: Issue with matching row results with scenario values of empty string and null. Reference: JavaScenarioNameTest in tabletest project shows the expected behavior.

title: Fix method name extraction to strip parameter types
description: Method name extraction in JunitTableMetadata.getTitle() currently uses testMethod.getName() which may include parameter types in some scenarios. Strip everything after '(' to get clean method name for title transformation and filename generation.

title: Revise README with end-to-end user workflow
description: Restructure README to focus on end-user workflow: adding JUnit extension, running tests, running plugin, and understanding how test structure/naming controls directory structure and web-friendly filenames in rendered output. Make it clearer how user choices (test names, @DisplayName, package structure) directly affect the final documentation.

title: Implement CLI compatibility tests
description: Create test scenarios that verify CLI can process YAML files generated by different JUnit versions and framework combinations. Verify both AsciiDoc and Markdown output generation.
close_reason: CLI compatibility tests implemented across all Maven test projects with AsciiDoc generation

title: Test and verify nested class YAML file creation
description: Test how YAML files are created for nested and deeply nested classes. Verify this matches assumptions in ReportTreeTest (e.g., shouldSupportNestedTestClasses)

title: Make pre-push hook selective based on changed files
description: The pre-push hook currently runs compatibility tests unconditionally. Enhance it to check which files changed (git diff --name-only) and skip compatibility tests for documentation-only changes, matching the logic in CLAUDE.md. This provides both efficiency (faster pushes for docs) and safety (automatic gate for core changes).

title: Add test for method names with parameter types
description: Write tests to verify that method name extraction correctly strips parameter types (e.g., 'methodName(java.lang.String, java.util.List)' should become 'methodName'). This ensures filenames don't become excessively long from parameter type information.

title: Add end-to-end test for AsciiDoc report rendering to HTML
Create framework compatibility test matrix
description: Design and implement compatibility tests that verify reporting works across: Maven/Gradle/CLI, JUnit 5.12+, Spring Boot 3.5.0+, Quarkus 3.21.2+. Should test both junit-platform.properties and build tool configuration approaches for extension autodetection.

title: spring-boot-latest: test inputDirectory by building to 'build' directory
Create compatibility-tests README
Add Quarkus compatibility note to README
description: Document that Quarkus projects with existing junit-platform.properties should use maven-surefire-plugin configurationParameter instead to enable autodetection. Add note to 'Alternative: Build Tool Configuration' section explaining this workaround for framework conflicts.

title: Provide YAML titles when rendering index page links
description: When creating index pages for packages/test classes, load the title field from child YAML files so links can use proper titles instead of slugified filenames

title: Investigate Spring Boot autodetection compatibility
description: Test whether Spring Boot projects can use junit-platform.properties or if they need maven-surefire-plugin configuration like Quarkus. Document findings and add to README if needed.
close_reason: Investigation complete. Spring Boot does not have junit-platform.properties conflicts like Quarkus. Spring Boot 3.5.0+ with JUnit 5.12+ handles junit-platform.properties without issues. The file is specifically for JUnit Platform config and is separate from Spring's test property sources (@TestPropertySource, application-test.properties). No workaround needed for Spring Boot users.

title: Implement Gradle compatibility tests
description: Create test projects using Gradle that verify TableTest Reporter works with different JUnit versions (5.12+) and frameworks (vanilla, Spring Boot, Quarkus). Test both autodetection configuration methods.
close_reason: Superseded by tabletest-reporter-2fk which captures specific technical blockers encountered

title: Create spring-boot-min compatibility test
Make use of new yaml field roleResults in AsciiDoc rendering
Create quarkus-latest compatibility test
Verify @Disabled tests are rendered correctly
Extract camelCase splitting logic from TitleTransformer and FilenameTransformer
description: Both TitleTransformer and FilenameTransformer contain identical camelCase word-boundary detection logic (lines 47-76 vs 64-89). Extract this to a shared utility that accepts a separator character and case transformation strategy. This eliminates ~30 lines of duplicated logic.

title: Implement Maven compatibility tests
description: Create test projects using Maven that verify TableTest Reporter works with different JUnit versions (5.12+) and frameworks (vanilla, Spring Boot, Quarkus). Test both autodetection configuration methods.
close_reason: Maven compatibility tests complete: junit-latest, spring-boot-min, spring-boot-latest, quarkus-min, quarkus-latest all implemented

title: spring-boot-latest: configure markdown format via plugin config
Create junit-latest compatibility test
spring-boot-latest: test custom outputDirectory configuration
Review compatibility tests for simplification opportunities
description:
Review compatibility-tests/ for opportunities to simplify, make faster, and/or make more maintainable without sacrificing coverage.

Areas to consider:
- Test script duplication across projects
- Redundant test scenarios
- Slow operations that could be optimized
- Common patterns that could be extracted
- Documentation clarity
- Test matrix coverage vs execution time

title: Support configurable result marker (currently only ends with ? by convention)
Create contract tests between junit and core modules
description: Add cross-module integration tests to verify the contract between junit and core. Options: 1) Dedicated contract-tests module that runs real junit tests and feeds YAML to core, 2) Build-time validation step. This prevents accidentally breaking the contract (YAML format, filename conventions, directory structure). Currently EndToEndTableReportTest uses hand-crafted fixtures which can drift from what junit actually produces.

title: Update README with filename transformation conventions
description: Document the filename transformation conventions in README.md based on FilenameTransformerTest: spaces→slugify, underscores→snake-to-kebab, camelCase→camel-to-kebab with acronym handling

title: Add end-to-end test for Markdown report rendering to HTML
